title: South Park
content:
Anyone else watch this, or are in love with it, like me?[quote]Quote:[hr]Just remember that this is the year of the elite devil.

1337 + 666 = 2003[hr][/quote][img]http://img259.imageshack.us/img259/3852/sheepsmall0sf.jpg[/img]

Talk about can of worms... this show has been around for quite some time--I recall the question of Eric Cartman's father being raised when I was in 10th grade, which was seven years ago. The show's gone through at least that many seasons, each with their own new (or discontinued) characters, twists, and gimmicks. The animation has evolved from cutouts under a manually-clicked camera to integration with computer software... there's a lot to work with, here.

I was interested in the show for a short period of time, and will watch it occasionally if it's on and I've got nothing else in mind, but I'm not an avid fan these days.

title: Re: ...
content:
Well, back then when they started to show it here I watched a few episodes, didn't especially like it. Nowadays I hate it. I don't like the "humour" and it's visually not appealing to me at all. So, no thanks.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: ...
content:
Actually, from what I understand, they were using Maya from episode 2 onwards (complete with experienced 3D animators, so they could get the "crappy paper look" - but they apparently "couldn't get it right until about the fourth episode").

Eric Cartman's father was that long ago? I just started wtaching it this schoolyear, so yeah [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] [quote]Quote:[hr]Just remember that this is the year of the elite devil.

1337 + 666 = 2003[hr][/quote][img]http://img259.imageshack.us/img259/3852/sheepsmall0sf.jpg[/img]

title: Re: ...
content: I like it, but I've only really found the more recent seasons to be funny. It was pretty dull when it focused mostly on retarded shock value. A lot of the newer episodes are hilarious, though.[center]<font color="MAROON">TOUGH GUYS DON'T FOLLOW FADS</font>[/center]

title: Re: ...
content:
Strangely enough, i eventually came to think of some of the later episodes as "superior" to the movie, no matter how little this made sense. I can't really tell the difference; some of the older episodes were hillarious in my day, but perhaps there somehow was.[quote]Quote:[hr]Just remember that this is the year of the elite devil.

1337 + 666 = 2003[hr][/quote][img]http://img259.imageshack.us/img259/3852/sheepsmall0sf.jpg[/img]

title: Re: ...
content:
I used to be into South Park in a big way. I even had a Mr Hankey t-shirt! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dexter.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-barf.gif[/img]
Nowadays, I don't usually bother watching it unless I remember to - which could be said of anything on TV really.
The humour of South Park is now at the same level of wit as such trashy sitcoms as "Friends" and ... um, well I can't think of any others because I don't watch sitcoms anymore.
The humour usually relies heavily on characters having catchphrases, almost as if the show is trying to come up with slogans for their T-shirts.

HOWEVER...

The writing is really good. The storylines are what "make" South Park. It's nice to see that there are still one or two TV shows that take this aspect of scriptwriting seriously.----------
www.StrifeStrips.com! Woot! We're back, baby!
